newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Fokus says holds 10 pct of BNbank.
newsitem.headline: Fokus says holds 10 pct of BNbank.

text.p: Norwegian bank Fokus Bank ASA holds 10 percent of the share capital of takeover target Bolig og Naeringsbanken (BNbank), a niche mortgage lender, a statement from the Oslo bourse said on Tuesday.
Fokus made a share exchange bid for BNbank on March 18.
However Norway's top commercial bank Den norske Bank ASA (DnB) stepped into the ring on March 21 by announcing a cash offer, which valued BNbank at around 1.90 billion crowns.
DnB said it would offer a cash payment of 184.50 crowns per share, plus BNbank's 1996 dividend of 10.50 crowns.
Fokus, the country's fourth latest bank, later the same day raised its share exchange ratio to 3.4 Fokus shares for each share in BNbank to value BNbank at 2.06 billion crowns.
